desc: Mustaml is a html template language that enforces "logic-less" templates as known from {{ mustache }} but using pythonish indentation like HAML to build html-tags. Here are some Examples of Mustaml usage.

unittests.title: Creating HTML-tags quickly
unittests.desc: You can create tags with the %tag styntax. Nesting is done via indentation. Tags are automatically closed.

unittests.title: Creating HTML-tags even quicker
unittests.desc: You can append child nodes directly to save lines:

unittests.title: Mixing nesting and appending
unittests.desc: For every node you append, we're nesting all child nodes that level deeper. This happens when mixing appending and nesting:

unittests.title: Adding classes and ids in CSS-syntax
unittests.desc: One of the Key features is quickly adding the common class and id attributes, with a syntax well known from CSS.

unittests.title: Implicit Divs
unittests.desc: To make things even easier, you can leave out %tag and Mustaml will guess it's a %div

unittests.title: HTML-Attributes
unittests.desc: Attributes are defined as usual but are appended in brackets. Yes, this is HTML-syntax and not some language-specific map with lots of @, => and so on.
unittests.html: Yo!

unittests.title: HTML-Comments
unittests.desc: You can insert html-comments too.

unittests.title: HTML-Comment-blocks
unittests.desc: End even put whole parts of your template into comment tags. This might come in handy if you don't want your users to see this part, but be able to check the rendering output.

unittests.title: Inserting Data
unittests.desc: Of course a template engine does output strings. They are escaped for HTML-output by default.

unittests.title: Inserting More Data
unittests.desc: The = tag doesn't want sub-nodes, so use parallel =tags like this:

unittests.title: Looping
unittests.desc: You can loop over arrays. The current value is available as ".".

unittests.title: Looping Maps
unittests.desc: And you can loop over maps. Inside the loop, you can access the map keys like normal vars.

unittests.title: Boolean Switches
unittests.desc: You can check for true/false values with the very same syntax.

unittests.title: Boolean Switches (false)
unittests.desc: A ^ indicates not, so the children are only shown if the value is false.

unittests.title: Boolean Switches (false positive)
unittests.desc: Consequently, the text is not rendered, if you get a true value with ^.

unittests.title: Boolean Switches (false positive)
unittests.desc: Another use of ^ is checking for unset values.

unittests.title: Empty Loops
unittests.desc: Another use of ^ is checking for empty arrays, strings and 0 numbers.

  -planets
    %li =. , G'day!
  -^planets

unittests.title: Escaping
unittests.desc: If you want to start a text line with a meta-character otherwise interpreted as some kind of node, you can escape it with a backslash.

unittests.title: Attributes with data
unittests.desc: You can provide a map for highly dynamic attributes.

unittests.title: Mustaml-Comments
unittests.desc: Mustaml-Comments are not rendered at all.

unittests.title: Mustaml-Comment-blocks
unittests.desc: Get rid of whole subtrees with Mustaml-Comments.
